rx.operators

Class OrderedZipOperators

  • java.lang.Object
    • rx.operators.OrderedZipOperators

  • public final class OrderedZipOperators
extends Object
    Returns an Observable which zips the results from two upstream Observables based on a joining function, keeping track of relative ordering. Created by tmeehan on 5/17/15.

    • Method Detail

      • zip

        public static final <KEY,LEFT_VALUE,RIGHT_VALUE,RESULT> Observable<RESULT> zip(Observable<LEFT_VALUE> leftHandSide,
                                                                               Observable<RIGHT_VALUE> rightHandSide,
                                                                               Comparator<KEY> ordering,
                                                                               Func1<? super LEFT_VALUE,KEY> leftHandKeyingFunction,
                                                                               Func1<? super RIGHT_VALUE,KEY> rightHandKeyingFunction,
                                                                               Func2<LEFT_VALUE,RIGHT_VALUE,RESULT> joinFunction,
                                                                               ZipType zipType)
        Returns an Observable which zips the results from two upstream Observables based on a joining function. Similar to the Zip operator, except this offers greater flexibility to selectively filter out data based on the type of zip type selected. This operator uses "reactive pull" backpressure to slow down the source observable in case it's over producing. This means the source of data from this stream should support backpressure. The easiest way to do this is to model it as an Iterable or Generator, or if this isn't possible, to use SyncOnSubscribe in the Observable.create method.
        Parameters:
        leftHandSide - the left side observable
        rightHandSide - the right side observable to be joined against
        ordering - a comparator which specifies the relative ordering of both streams
        leftHandKeyingFunction - a function which returns a key value, used by the comparator to determine the relative location in the stream
        rightHandKeyingFunction - a function which returns a key value, used by the comparator to determine the relative location in the stream
        joinFunction - a function which join the values from the two streams
        zipType - the type of join to perform -- left, full outer, and inner (as in SQL)
        Returns:
        the joined observable

      • zipWith

        public static final <KEY,LEFT_VALUE,RIGHT_VALUE,RESULT> Observable.Transformer<LEFT_VALUE,RESULT> zipWith(Observable<RIGHT_VALUE> rightHandSide,
                                                                                                          Comparator<KEY> ordering,
                                                                                                          Func1<? super LEFT_VALUE,KEY> leftHandKeyingFunction,
                                                                                                          Func1<? super RIGHT_VALUE,KEY> rightHandKeyingFunction,
                                                                                                          Func2<LEFT_VALUE,RIGHT_VALUE,RESULT> joinFunction,
                                                                                                          ZipType zipType)
        Returns a Transformer which zips the results from the source observable with another observable based on a joining function. Similar to the Zip operator, except this offers greater flexibility to selectively filter out data based on the type of zip type selected. Used with the Observable.compose(rx.Observable.Transformer<? super T, ? extends R>) method to provide method chaining (for an example see above). This operator uses "reactive pull" backpressure to slow down the source observable in case it's over producing. This means the source of data from this stream should support backpressure. The easiest way to do this is to model it as an Iterable or Generator, or if this isn't possible, to use SyncOnSubscribe in the Observable.create method.
        Parameters:
        rightHandSide - the observable to join against
        ordering - a comparator which specifies the relative ordering of both streams
        leftHandKeyingFunction - a function which returns a key value, used by the comparator to determine the relative location in the stream
        rightHandKeyingFunction - a function which returns a key value, used by the comparator to determine the relative location in the stream
        joinFunction - a function which join the values from the two streams
        zipType - the type of join to perform -- left, outer, and inner
        Returns:
        the joined observable
